field_edited_text.value:
34 SUSQUEHANNA RivER BRIDGE

MAINTENANCE, OPERATION, AND INSURANCE

Coverdale and Colpitts have also estimated the operating expenses for
each of the crossings in the program, and the tabulation of such expenses
for the operation, maintenance and insurance requirements for the pro-
posed Susquehanna River Bridge are herein tabulated for ready reference.

(Table 2.)

TRAFFIC REPORT
Coverdale and Colpitts, Consulting Engineers, New York City, under
date of September 3, 1938 have reported to the State Roads Commission on

TABLE 3
Recommended Toll Schedule



TOLL



Cash One Way Tickets (Note)



1. Passenger Cars
This classification includes taxicabs, ambulances, hearses
and light delivery vans with automobile bodies.
Including driver and passengers up to normal seating ca-

pacity butnotover 6............. ... ... i, $0.20 $0.15
Passenger car trailer (4 or more wheels).................... 0.20
Passenger car semi-trailer (2 wheels)....................... 0.10
1I. Buses
Including driver and passengers—Through bus............. 0.30
Local or school bus........ 0.20
1II. Trucks
Including driver and helper
2- or 3-axle trucks—Capacity under 2 tons............... 0.25 0.1875
2- or 3-axle trucks—Capacity 2 tons to 5 tons............ 0.30 0.225
2- or 3-axle trucks—Capacity over 5tons................ 0.40 0.30

Tractor and semi-trailer................................. 0.40 0.30

above. ... .. 0.05







Note: Reduced fare tickets sold for the vehicular classifications indicated in books of 25 or 50 at
the rates specified. No reduced fare tickets accepted unless detached by toll taker from books in
which sold.
